title: Genotyping and gene function in healthy volunteers

producedBy.name: Genotyping and gene function in healthy volunteers

studyGroups.name: Genotyping and gene function in healthy volunteers

values: Subjects with no history of chronic infectious or immune diseases
NOT sampling during current acute infection
Subjects who agree to be available to be recalled for blood sampling for ex vivo studies
Subjects with history of chronic infectious or immune diseases

creators.name: Population Genetics Analysis Program: Immunity to Vaccines/Infections

values.value: Our central purpose is to investigate variability in host genes predicting variation in antibody reponses and adverse reactions to Anthrax Vaccine Adsorbed (AVA). The results should more generally enhance our understanding of the immune response in the context of vaccines, pathogenic agents and autoimmunity.  https://www.fbo.gov/index?s=opportunity&mode=form&tab=core&id=57844bf8ab61f31368b70452adf994b5

primaryPublications.authorsList: Pajewski NM(1), Parker SD, Poland GA, Ovsyannikova IG, Song W, Zhang K, McKinney  BA, Pankratz VS, Edberg JC, Kimberly RP, Jacobson RM, Tang J, Kaslow RA.
primaryPublications.title: The role of HLA-DR-DQ haplotypes in variable antibody responses to anthrax vaccine adsorbed.

availability: Available for download after registration with ImmPort

dimensions.description: Multiplex assays to measure cytokines, chemokines, and related protein products in healthy volunteers. 86 samples, with relatively equal representation of African Americans versus European Americans and males versus females. Custom SearchLight assays (Pierce Biotechnology)

Assessment of genetic variations associated with immune responses against Anthrax Vaccine Adsorbed (AVA). Genotpyiong was performed byagarose gel elecrophoresis plus ethidium bromide staining to assess the number of 37-nt tandem repeats following PCR of this region of the FCRN gene in selected healthy control participants. 146 samples assayed. To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

Assessment of genetic variations associated with immune responses against Anthrax Vaccine Adsorbed (AVA). 200 samples assayed. To obtain these genotyping results, please follow the process described here. To download the Genotyping Data Request form, click here.

Illumina's iSelect custom genotyping panel was used for genotyping the 2306 subjects at 7800 SNPs using the Illumina's Infinium II assay in the AVA project. This experiment describes the QC process used to select the SNPs that were assayed in the Illumina iSelect custom genotyping panel for the SNP genotyping experiment in the AVA project.

distributions.title: Genotyping and gene function in healthy volunteers

acknowledges.name: Population Genetics Analysis Program: Immunity to Vaccines/Infections

description: Functionally important genetic variants (certain naturally occurring SNPs) in a set of candidate genes that are known to be relevant for immune response to protein antigens, are expected to be associated with AbPA response and B-cell physiology.
